subject: Gardening
title: Monet's Giverny: Painting a Garden
description: A short lesson to help you apply Monet's Giverny: Painting a Garden.

hook.text: Claude Monet didn't just paint gardens. He designed Giverny specifically to be paintedâ€”a garden built for art.

buildup.text: Monet spent 43 years cultivating Giverny. He employed six gardeners and obsessed over color combinations in every bed.

discovery.text: The water lily pond was engineered by diverting a river. Monet fought local authorities for permission to build it.

twist.text: Monet painted 250 water lily canvases. He wasn't painting natureâ€”he was painting a composition he'd designed.

climax.text: Giverny blurs the line between art and garden. The paintings are records of a designed living canvas, not wild nature.

punchline.text: Monet built the garden, then painted it 250 times.

quiz.question: What makes Monet's Giverny unique in art history?
options: It was the first garden to be photographed in color
Monet designed the garden specifically to serve as his painting subject
It was the only garden that Impressionist painters were allowed to visit
